turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Shields (keelboat).
turn.2: Shields (keelboat) The Shields class is a class of keelboat devised in 1963 by US sailor Cornelius Shields, one of the foremost proponents of one-design sailing in the US.
turn.3: What was the inspiration for the design?
turn.4: He conceived of a modern followup to the International One Design (IOD).
turn.6: The new boat would have the balance and beauty of the IOD while incorporating modern trends such as fiberglass construction.
turn.7: Did anyone help with the design?
turn.8: Shields commissioned Olin Stephens of Sparkman and Stephens for the design.
turn.10: The boat was intended for use by the yacht clubs around the Long Island Sound near New York, for racing and training.
turn.12: The first batch of 20 boats were built at the Cape Cod Shipyard, and donated to training schools on the US east coast.
